info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:22PM CDT until July 22 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL NORTON AND EASTERN DECATUR COUNTIES... At 622 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles west of Norcatur, or 11 miles east of Oberlin, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. Public reported quarter size hail in Norcatur. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Norcatur, Jennings, Clayton and Kanona. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
